content.question: A 10-foot ladder is leaning straight up against a wall when a person begins pulling the base of the ladder away from the wall at the rate of 1 foot per second. Which of the following is true about the distance between the top of the ladder and the ground when the base of the ladder is 9 feet from the wall?

choices.label: The distance is increasing at a rate of <math alttext="the fraction 9 over the square root of 19" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>19</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> feet per second.

The distance is decreasing at a rate of <math alttext="the fraction 9 over the square root of 19" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>19</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> feet per second.

The distance is increasing at a rate of <math alttext="the fraction the square root of 19, over 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>19</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> feet per second.

The distance is decreasing at a rate of <math alttext="the fraction the square root of 19, over 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>19</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> feet per second.

content.answer: The distance is decreasing at a rate of <math alttext="the fraction 9 over the square root of 19" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>19</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> feet per second.

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
